H0.text: Desiccation and predators are what the fungal cell wall protects the cell from, thanks to the structural strength provided by chitin.

H1.text: Fermentation and predators are what the cell wall of fungi protects the cell from, thanks to the structural strength provided by chitin, which is also found in the exoskeleton of insects.

H2.text: Entrainment and predators are what the chitinous cell wall of fungi protects the cell from.

H3.text: Starvation and predators are what the fungal cell wall protects the cell from, because chitin gives the cell wall structural strength.

A4.text: This allows for increased hydrogen bonding between adjacent polymers, giving the chitin-polymer matrix increased strength.

A5.text: It is a primary component of cell walls in fungi (especially filamentous and mushroom-forming fungi), the exoskeletons of arthropods such as crustaceans and insects
